info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 6 at 8:45AM CDT until May 8 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County.
Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County.
Trinity River Near Long Lake (Oakwood) affecting Freestone, Anderson and Leon Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Denton Creek near Justin.
* WHEN...From this evening to Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor out of bank flooding will occur to farm and ranch lands near the creek.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 10.9 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY MORNING
